content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Short version: I started playing this game without having tried Arma II yet. I had no idea what I was doing, got shot at in the first few seconds and then got mauled by a zombie. 10/10Second playthrough, long version. Started off way to the southeast of the map (map takes you like well over a couple hours to cross by the way, it's pretty huge), killed a dozen zombies with a machete and nearly died trying to get into a building. Made my way 3 kilometers north to a major town while being unable to find a single scrap of food and only getting empty water bottles. Killed another dozen on my way sneaking in, filled up my water bottles and had a whole minute to drink before I got swarmed. Racked my way up to ~50 kills while barely conscious before I backed up onto a hospital roof, with the hospital now surrounded by zombies. Ate the food and water I'd managed to scrounge up, slipped down the rear ladder that only had a few zombies by it. Quietly chopped them up and slipped in, to find no medical supplies. Headed north to a military airfield, hoping it had a medical bay. On my way, found a jeep loaded with a rifle and some ammo, stole it and kept heading north. Got to the airfield, picked up an M16 but couldn't get any medical supplies. Headed off to the woods and logged off.Logged back in, drove back to the airfield and got shot by a sniper. Spawned a while away, found a second (glitched) copy of my jeep that someone had taken and crashed to the side of the road, probably dying inside it. Got in, headed back to the airfield, shot the bandit with a full mag from my glock before coming up behind him and inserting a machete into his rectal area. Got my gear back, the medical supplies I no longer needed, a new giant backpack, and a choice of the items from the 4 other dead bodies he'd killed that were laying around. Shanked some more zombies, headed in the woods with a fully loaded military jeep and an assault rifle fitted with a grenade launcher. Logged off, looking forward to blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up tomororw. 10/10

												DayZ Mod is a beautiful experience. This is the mod that started the early-access survival game genre. You can expect the same gameplay and bugs that were present when the game came out. I would recommend playing on a vanilla server such as Europa and US434.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												DayZ is a brilliant mod and soon to have its own standalone game. Best played with a group of friends/players but can also be played alone. Also be prepared to trek the whole map (which is 100km2 ) to maximise how well you do in game. You do have to be prepared to gather alot of 'loot' and prepare to loose it in a second. The mentality of the players for the game has changed since it's growing popularity and now alot of players will shoot of sight. You might get lucky and get the one friendly guy but that's one in a million.A couple things to note before getting the mod:1. DayZ Standalone Alpha(er) is soon to be released so If you have patience, maybe waiting for the SA is a good idea2. The game is not well optimized with alot of players complaining about FPS. In the open fields you will reach your maximun FPS but towns and build up areas will effect your FPS.3. If you aren't into games which involve talking to people, just be warned that comunication with others players will slow with swapping between different chat channels, talking and moving is slightly complicated.There are alot of other factors that go with the mod like using external programs to search through servers and error problems but google is your friend and you can easily find a fix.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												My First day in DayZ!------------------------So these guys lived at the airfield, me being hostile and with a glock and a machete, wanted to say hi. Befor i did that i noticed that they were 7 had a chopper, 2 humvees, and 2 red offroaders and also alot of big guns. They were killing some guys, when i decided to kill 2 of them, which i did :D ( i killed 2 guys with a glock and 1 had an AK-47, and the other an Lee Enfield) after looting them i noticed there was another guy like 5 metrs behind me telling me to put down my guns. That scared the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of me so i got on my bike whiche was next to me and started to pedal away. I was so lucky that, that guy didnt know how to shoot, but almost killed me, i had 2000 blood left (max is 12000), and a broken leg. i drow my bike in too the woods, patched up and noticed that there was a heli above me and 2 humvees behind me, so i ran farther, i shot the heli, so it would fly away, so it did. But then i remembered the humvees. I ran into the nearest city and hid in a barn, i thought that i lost then, but they knew that i was some where close. i saw 4 of them looking for me and i managed to kille 2 of them and disconnect. the i got on my bike and ran again, till the got bored of chasing me...-------------------------------------------16/10 - would raid with a glock again :D-------------------------------------------------If you want to find out how to play and install dayz mod properly, contact me,plz, il be happy to help you, it wont take much time, depends on your internet connection :)

content:
Posted: January 26, 2014
												Better than the standalone from what I heard, the DayZ mod is an extremely well done Arma 2 Combined Operations mod. With the great gameplay and tons of heated moments this game is great for anybody that is into survival and action games. There are some downsides though, for one the steam download is out of date, so you need to use a 3rd party software like DayZ Commander to properly lauch the game you also need a decent computer to run the game efficiently, but if you are really persistant you shouldn't have a problem running it at 30fps on lowest settings using intel integrated graphics 4000, but overal this game is great and much much better than anything else like it. Buy the games and get this mod!

content:
Posted: February 7
												I liked the Idea of the Mod but I'm just going to pick on Gameplay. Imagine you spend 1.5hrs trying to find a gun and you get killed by a zombie or player who you assumed was friendly. The devs have to cut back on zombies and disable their run features, they should only crawl or walk slow. I get it's a SHTF situation but you would survive if you were in a group. Fortunatly for me I often get chased for 10-20 km's by zombies and I do marathons. I would reccomend the Mod, but I would reccomend to balance Zombies, Weapons, Players, Resources, Gameplay

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												DayZ Review:I entered the game. I got a message, "Cannot connect to servers" I'm shaking. I put on my cardboard decoy of the oculus rift as I enter this zombie infested land. I hear people walking towards me. "Take the dog out!" I hear. My friend told me to say I'm friendly. "I'm Friendly" I shout. I feel what felt like a punch to my stomach. The man left. I look at the bottom right of my stomach. I'm starving. I can't get to the fridge... It's to far away. I'm also thirsty but when am I not? I swear everything is blurring out... This game is feeling too real. I went down the stairs to see 3 guys, a man who looked old, a young man, and a baby. "Go upstairs conor" How did he know my name? I ran in panic and ripped of my Fabulous rift. This is almost as scary as freddy foozbear. 10/10 Best survival game to exsist, better than call of duty- ign

content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												Although far superior, and actually finished, than the StandAlone version, the DayZ mod seems to be dying and windling away as more players go towards the use of mods as well as towards StandAlone to improve the gaming quality. Of course, the best way to enhance your DayZ Mod experience is to use DayZ Commander, which will warrant the use of mods to be downloaded- and as a result opening up a vast array of servers to play on. That is provided you have Combined Operations installed (Operation Arrowhead, and all the other DLC's for Arma 2).It's the forerunner to StandAlone, the best and finalised version of DayZ, but with the basic and original implementations that the DayZ SA developers want to integrate to the SA game. Overall, alright for a laugh and its free- get a taste for DayZ before you get the Standalone. But you might end up finding some problems along the way.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2014
												Quick Note: I have many more hours in game, however since I started using DayZ Commander  to play DayZ Epoch Servers, it doesn't continue listing.In DayZ, death is inevitable... You'll start of in a massive setting you know nothing about, with no clue where to go or what to do. You'll likely try to be quick on your feet to find some useful stuff to survive, which will more then likely get you killed, and yet, you'll want to try again. Slowly you'll learn it's better to sneak around in the shadows and crawl for hundreds of feet on your belly simply to find some Frank n Beans, then before long you'll be set with supplies, proud of your accomplishments, possibly even finding a nice ride to store your loot and get around safetly until.... An unnoticed survivor in the distance decides to take your head off with his DMR. This game can be brutaly hard in the wrong situations, but very fun and fulfilling in the right ones, just remember the zeds are plenty, and trust no one because most these survivors would kill their own mother for a can of Pepsi.I'd suggest anyone who wishes to play this should get DayZ Commander and update the mod to better versions with more functionality providing more immersion. As stated above, I now play DayZ Epoch, which adds a great deal to the game. I myself have chosen to go onto PvE servers where players team up to survive and take on the Zeds and AI Bandits and love it. This mod will surely give me thousands of hours of gameplay, and not very many games can pull that off for me. I'm way behind everyone else getting into this DayZ craze, I avoided it for a long time because despite all the die hard fans, a lot complained about bugs and issues, but I myself have run into very few bugs (Most of which were on the basic version installed here on Steam) and none of them were game breaking. If you see ArmA2 Combined Ops on sale, buy it.

content:
Posted: April 24
												One of the saddest IPs ever. I played this game tons back in '12 & '13. It was sketchy back then (ran my own server), but it's just full on jankie now. I attempted to get a new server going (Apr '17), and it was even worse in terms of getting it working than it was a few years back. What a great idea - an official sandbox zombie survival game. And it is it's worst enemy. It should be at least approachable by now, but alas, its stagnant development & support is definitely showing its effects. Do not buy the standalone in hopes all issues have been ironed out - it's EVEN WORSE, and the cover charge of $35 is laughable! Avoid this abandaned IP, no matter how much you're tempted to kill zeds with friends; try a copycat title - they are worth more than this.

content:
Posted: April 10
-Disclosure (I only bought this during Christmas, therefore being quite a late DayZ Player.)For a game that has been abandoned by it's developers due to Standalone and Arma 3, I still believe that this game has a good vibe to it. Survival aspects are cool, however my main issues are as of follows;Issues~1. Glitches, granted it's a Mod however, I'm sure if the developers gave the game a few more months to perhaps stabalize it, and maybe code it better? Then maybe it will have an affect on the communities attitude towards the game and perhaps wouldn't have them quitting due to their hard work lost by a zombie that glitched through a wall and knocked them off the edge of a tower.2. Small Player Base, which creates a dead aspect towards Multiplayer. The big servers are your only hope, and even then it has about 40+ players sometimes, and in my opinion it's difficult to find loot on such populated servers meaning your experience isn't as spectacular as you would've seen from perhaps a Youtubers or Streamers POV.In conclusion, I do not recommend DayZ, just because the player base is slowly decreasing, although, my opinion may change in the future. Even though the game is dying, I am not prepared to declare it a bad game. So for the communities experience, I would suggest not buying the Combined Operations Pack which allows you to install DayZ Mod for full price which in GBP is £16.99, however, on sale I have seen it being reduced to £3.49. So perhaps on sale, sure buy it for the sake of it being quite a big PC Game. Rating on gameplay: 5/10

content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												If you are wanting a short review before my rant then i will simply say:Good amounts of content but a frustrating and glitchy pile of junk.Dayz may be a popular mod for arma2 but besides the shear amount of content to choose from you would not know it. Most games with cult followings have fan made patches or fixes to polish out the rough edges and make the game more enjoyable.This is not the case with the dayz mod. The game feels and looks terrible it plays even worse.Animations are poor as are the response times when you press a command key.Example you are in a house when a zombie runs inside and approaches you,you hit a key to draw a weapon only to have it take about 10 seconds all the while the zombie is chomping on your neck.Glitches that should have been fixed by somebody or anybody ruin the immersion and make even simple tasks a nightmare. There is no excuse for a game having been out this long to posses such a myriad of faults and glitches.This is assuming you can even get the game to run for more than 30 minutes before it drops you for no apparent reason. can say with certainty that i have spent more time Patching,Fixing ,Updating and doing general maintenance and troubleshooting problems than actually playing the game.How this mod is so popular i will never know it is a over-complicated pile of junk.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												I came from like 500 hours in DayZ mod before Dayz for Steam, and i can say that this is one of the best game i ever played. It's not for people who thinks that this is a easy game, like Call of Duty, but it's for people who want more realism in a game.I played in Chernarus, in Fallujha (best map i think, you need to prove it), Chernarus Epoch, Panthera, Utes and much more. I never, and i said never, get bored.Lots of weapons, awesome graphic engine, pvp, driving and stuff, farming, zombies everywhere, looting... Awesome!10/10 Just a tip: for everyone who want to start to play Dayz, you should play a bit of singleplayer or armory in ArmaII, just for understand the basic of this game.

												DayZ - это когда бежишь через 10 деревнь чтобы увидеть братишку и умираешь от голодаDayZ - это когда скушав гнилой банан, ты умираешь через полчасаDayZ - это когда топор бьет вправоDayZ - это когда в положении лежа попадаешь в землю перед собойDayZ - это когда все домики на всех серверах облутаныDayZ - это когда чуханы с фул эквипом кемпят нубоспотыDayZ - это когда убивают через текстурыDayZ - это когда снимаешь с плеча винтовку 3 секундыDayZ - это когда переходишь в боевую стойку секундуDayZ - это когда перезаряжаешь оружие 3 секунды и только стояDayZ - это когда топор лучше дробовикаDayZ - это когда не знаешь что делать: перезаряжаться или снимать с плеча другое оружиеDayZ - это когда имея всё снаряжение, теряешь сознание от чухана с кулакамиDayZ - это когда имея всё снаряжение и стреляя в чухана в футболке в упор, вызываешь кровотечение, а он тебя убивает сразуDayZ - это когда хотел выкинуть стеклоочиститель, но зачем-то выпил его и умер через полчасаDayZ - это когда хотел спрыгнуть с двух метров, но упал и умерDayZ - это когда ты отошел в туалет, а когда вернулся твой персонаж умерDayZ - это когда ты 99% времени бежишь а 1% - это внезапная смертьDayZ - это когда ты открываешь огромным топором консервы10/10

content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
												If you're contemplaiting grabbing the games needed to play this, I will tell you two things:1) Get ready for a bit of frustration (though it is worth it in the end)2) Keep an eye out for them to be on sale (They constantly drop to like 5 bucks for the whole package)DayZ Mod is one of my all-time favorite games with the caveat that its the Epoch Mod for the Mod (modception) that I love the most. Vanilla DayZmod is decent, but nothing beats the base crafting and additional features of Epoch.If you do end up grabbing the game, go and get DayZ Launcher. Some will say to grab DayZ commander, which is fine...I've just had much better experiences with Launcher over the two. You'll need to verify all the files, and both of these programs do that. After that, you can install mods, I'd highly recommend Epoch.When you get into the game, spend some time getting used to the controls. You will eventually make use of nearly every listed control from corner leaning to get a shot in, to the helicopter controls, to the button to toggle your lights on and off. My advice for the first bit of the game is to find a nice, easy PVE server and just♥♥♥♥♥♥around until you get the hang of it.Epoch Survival is then, unoffically, in tiers:Tier 1: Newspawn; you've got what little invetory you have and you need to find food and water to survive. You'll be going house to house looking for weapons and what not. Even if you start with a gun, you don't want to fire it. Sneak around and keep a low profile. Avoid Zeds at all costs until you find a melee weapon.Tier 2: You've got your melee weapon, now find a car or something you can sell to get a car. Make your way north and look for one of the trader towns and sell your loot for enough gold to get a el cheapo car. You'll then use the car to go out looking for better loot -AND- the car can be locked for a kind of mobile base that is safe to store things in when logging off.Tier 3: Save your Gold and get an MTVR. This military truck will hold a TON of items, it can take a hail of bullets, and handels really well off road. It will be your mobile base for a while, and you'll probably hold onto it even after you get 'better' cars and a base. With it, head up to one of the military bases and raid the barracks for weapons. Sell the weapons  you don't upgrade with and start saving for a plot-post (on servers that require them, which is default).Tier 4: When you get a plot post, you'll need to make sure you have pretty much all the toolbelt items (Crowbar, E-tool, hatchet/axe, etc). Find a nice spot and stake your claim by dropping your plot post. Then its time for Lumberjack Simulator 2015. Get out in the woods and start chopping down some trees and collecting wood to start building your base defenses. You don't really need a safe as long as you have a lockable truck, but its up to you.Tier 5: Sticking with the MTVR runs to the military bases, keep farming gold until you get enough to buy a helicopter. Leave your truck at your base locked up and make the run, bike, or whatever to the airbase and buy a Mozzie. Why this uselss♥♥♥♥♥heli? Because you're probably going to crash it. Everyone I have played this game with has crashed their first helicopter, regardless of how many hours they've spent in Arma's helicopter training or Bohemia's helicopter game. Get the mozzie, take it slow and easy staying low to the ground, then when you've got it down, sell it and get your real chopper. Go for the civillian chopper, since its basically an airborn MTVR.Tier 6: Keep hitting military bases, which should now go by even faster. If you think you're up to it, you can try and smash some bandit missions (Depending on the server) for some fast cash and good mats. Keep builing up your base and consider getting a fuel truck. From this point on, you're done 'surviving' Epoch, you're now 'thriving'.Play the game with friends and have even more of a blast.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												I recommend this game for anybody intrested in zombie survival. This game makes you feel like you are in a Zombie Apocalypse. It requires you to make Life-Saving decisions in seconds. This game requires skill and patience. If you make one wrong move you might need to start over. There are also mods for this mod. One I recommend is Dayz Epoch. Dayz Epoch adds over 500 new vehicles and over 100 new weapons. Dayz Epoch adds trader areas where you can sell stuff for gold, silver, and a few other metals. With these metals you can buy Land vehicles, Aircrafts, Boats, Weapons, and even other survival goodies. Dayz Epoch gives you the power to build your own base using Plot pole and wood. Dayz epoch is what kept me playing Dayz. If you were to ever buy Arma 2 Combined Arms be sure to pick this up, Also be sure to install Dayz commander to play, it adds A favorites list and sometimes if you play this without Dayz Commander it will say wrong version everytime you try.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
												The mod have gone thrugh another update and what does it adds? Well.. nothing much, beside that the base building has came back to the game, which I'm not a big fan and it kinda destroys the survival concept of the game.. enough of that for a moment and let's get in to the point of this review and say what the game is real about.It's been a while since the game got their rewards and most you you wouldn't look at it again after.. some other games coming out and removing the AS50 (!) from the game.. I feel like the game has rached gold age again with the update from the last month and they still keep on going with these. From the beginning you will see that this review is delivered for those who actually played the game or got it already in the past for long time but I'll try to turn back in time for a little while because that's what it provides and that's what I think is the most immportant that's left in this game. The game throws us in to zombie land of Charnorus -or/and vice versa- speaking about this as a world makes us think that it must be pretty big thing to move around on (walkin simulator?) and.. yes, it's.. an open world game aswell! With a mixture of realistic, simulator based combat system and variety if immportant to a player needs which can be challenging sometimes to keep up with them while you're running away from pursuing enemies; and there is plenty of them! Starting from your needs and health contidion status to end it on a players that are going for the same building as you are in a hope of finding this valuble loot. You could say that the game is made of such a little personal goals that you are seeking in any part of the game and this would be the best way to put it. Just planing your safe route to the city might be the starting point of this and thinking of whatever is needed to get this sniper out from that hill would be another level of challenging goals that you want to chose from and pick them as their own because anyone can chase them doing it from all sorts of level of the map and the game.One of the game that should get a chance from anyone who played in the past but also someone who didn't played it at all because anyone can find themselfs in the game.

Posted: January 14, 2014
												I came from like 500 hours in DayZ mod before Dayz for Steam, and i can say that this is one of the best game i ever played. It's not for people who thinks that this is a easy game, like Call of Duty, but it's for people who want more realism in a game.I played in Chernarus, in Fallujha (best map i think, you need to prove it), Chernarus Epoch, Panthera, Utes and much more. I never, and i said never, get bored.Lots of weapons, awesome graphic engine, pvp, driving and stuff, farming, zombies everywhere, looting... Awesome!10/10 Just a tip: for everyone who want to start to play Dayz, you should play a bit of singleplayer or armory in ArmaII, just for understand the basic of this game.

content:
Posted: April 7, 2014
												Somehow this game is really enjoyable. It feels a bit glitchy at times particularly with the AI controlled bandits. And the servers all seem to have to restart every 2-4 hours which can lead to bad timing for a slow loading game. And getting Arma II, Operation arrowhead and day z mod all set up properly was a pain. I found the learning curve to be a bit steep for someone who has never played a survival sim game before and the menu system (particularly the backpack menu) to be absolutely terrible. These previous comments are negative and I find these annoying parts of the game, but then I discovered that stuff happens while you are trying to survive out there. And trying to become more powerful than other players by collecting weapons and vehicles (and stealing stuff from them) becomes addicting. I can't wait for the full standalone version to be completed, but until then this glitchy game is surprisingly great fun.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2016
												Is this game funny? Yes, it is.Is this game awesome? Yes, it is.But still I wouldn't recommend this game. If compared to the Standalone version this game looks like crap. It's badly optimized, it has much less weapons, helicopters, vehicles and clothes than DayZ Standalone, and it gets updated once every year. Minimum requirements are fake as well, as if you have a low pc you won't ever run this game at more than 20fps, even if you put graphic settings at very low. Maybe with the lowest resolution you could run it, but who is that dumb to play a survival game in 800x600?

Posted: April 14, 2015
												I didn't know what to write for my review so here are some facts about ebola!!!Ebola virus disease (EVD; also Ebola hemorrhagic fever, or EHF), or simply Ebola, is a disease of humans and other primates caused by ebolaviruses. Signs and symptoms typically start between two days and three weeks after contracting the virus with a fever, sore throat, muscular pain, and headaches. Then, vomiting, diarrhea and rash usually follow, along with decreased function of the liver and kidneys. At this time some people begin to bleed both internally and externally. The disease has a high risk of death, killing between 25 and 90 percent of those infected with an average of about 50 percent. This is often due to low blood pressure from fluid loss, and typically follows six to sixteen days after symptoms appear.The virus spreads by direct contact with body fluids, such as blood, of an infected human or other animals. This may also occur through contact with an item recently contaminated with bodily fluids.[1] Spread of the disease through the air between primates, including humans, has not been documented in either laboratory or natural conditions.♥♥♥♥♥♥♥or breast milk of a person after recovery from EVD may still carry the virus for several weeks to months. Fruit bats are believed to be the normal carrier in nature, able to spread the virus without being affected by it. Other diseases such as malaria, cholera, typhoid fever, meningitis and other viral hemorrhagic fevers may resemble EVD. Blood samples are tested for viral RNA, viral antibodies or for the virus itself to confirm the diagnosis.Control of outbreaks requires coordinated medical services, alongside a certain level of community engagement. The medical services include rapid detection of cases of disease, contact tracing of those who have come into contact with infected individuals, quick access to laboratory services, proper healthcare for those who are infected, and proper disposal of the dead through cremation or burial. Samples of body fluids and tissues from people with the disease should be handled with special caution. Prevention includes limiting the spread of disease from infected animals to humans. This may be done by handling potentially infected bush meat only while wearing protective clothing and by thoroughly cooking it before eating it. It also includes wearing proper protective clothing and washing hands when around a person with the disease.No specific treatment or vaccine for the virus is available, although a number of potential treatments are being studied. Supportive efforts, however, improve outcomes. This includes either oral rehydration therapy (drinking slightly sweetened and salty water) or giving intravenous fluids as well as treating symptoms. The disease was first identified in 1976 in two simultaneous outbreaks, one in Nzara, and the other in Yambuku, a village near the Ebola River from which the disease takes its name. EVD outbreaks occur intermittently in tropical regions of sub-Saharan Africa. Between 1976 and 2013, the World Health Organization reports a total of 24 outbreaks involving 1,716 cases. The largest outbreak is the ongoing epidemic in West Africa centered in Guinea, Sierra Leone and Liberia. As of 11 April 2015, this outbreak has 25,626 reported cases resulting in 10,619 deaths.I R8 A VERY GR8 8/8 PLS DONT H8 AND TRY NOT TO MAKE IT B8 BUT QUICKSCOPING IS MY F8 PEACE OUT GONNA MASTURB8 ON YOUR LAMINATE FLOORING M8!!!!

number of helpful: 16 of 34 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												Absolute garbage, mod or not. Maybe if you're an autist with an ungodly amount of patience you can find enjoyment, but even then I doubt it. For those familiar with ARMA, it's similar in concept, but the execution is terrible. Interface is clunky and unresponsive, zombie AI is laughable as they jitter and zig zag haphazardly and glitch out uncontrollably. Forget words like matchmaking, navigating to a server through the sea of CU$T0M [300+ ITEMS M0D] SERV3RZ is a struggle in itself (Look into DayZ Commander if you're hellbent on a bad time). Clearly any kind of melee system was not anticipated in ARMA, and it reflects itself in Day Z. This is the worst FPS and survival experience I've played to date. Hyper realism is wasted on sluggish controls and a terrible GUI, you won't have time to enjoy bullet trajectory while you're panicked, starving, and hyperventilating from tripping on your own legs. Prepare yourself to wander aimlessly for hours through the "massive scale" in a desolate wasteland trying to figure out the controls (or location) while picking up empty food cans, before you die a hundred frustrating deaths and lose everything-- all the while facing the elistist community. The difficulty lie not in the zombies or players, but in the constant struggle against a buggy, awful game.This isn't difficult in the way Dark Souls or STALKER's Misery Mod is, it's like driving a broken tricyle backwards during a marathon. Even at ultra-low HumbleBundle price, I regret my purchase immensely and I truly misunderstand anyone liking this game.

content:
Posted: June 8, 2014
												I have been playing a long time using dayz commander not on steam. It is impossible to get started or even enjoy this game if you are going to be playing by yourself. Get some friends or don't play. (iunless you like running around for hours on end and getting shot and having to run around again.)But here's how it normally goes.You spawn in on the coast with nothing but a pistol and a bandage. You run around for over an hour looking for some gear. Picking up a soda here, a can of beans there. BAM! Some fully geared player just shot you before you could even get a weapon. On your second try you spawn in and run around four another 2 hours and finally find a low level waepon like a lee enfield. You then see someone, get excited and say "hello! are you friendly?" and BAM!. they shoot you and take your gear without a word. This cycle repeats over and over until you realize you just spent 8 hours running and getting shot on sight and running around and getting shot on sight and running around and getting shot and never really accomplishing anything.  EVERYONE shoots on sight in this game. EVERYONE. Unless you have some friends to cover your back this will keep happening to you. It's not a open world survival game... it's a giant free-for-all deathmatch.  I wouldn't reccomend this game to anyone who is planning on playing it by themselves.  You will get frustrated and bored very quicly.

												So i played other survival games, and this one I always thought that i would have a nice experience, but it wasn't, unfortunately i spent some money to buy arma and all expansions just to play dayz mod, i know i didn't have to buy, but i wanted to try arma too 'cause it seemed to be a nice game, but dayz is wrong in so many ways that i don't even know where to start, there is no real game servers, ervery server is different in it's on way so this is bad as you'll never really be playing dayz, you'll be playing some shell to arma and every server has it's on start caractheristics, for example, if you are washed away on the shores of an unknow continent, YOU DON'T HAVE A GLOCK! you'll have your bare fists or a knife any kind of melee weapon and that's it, for only one reason, if you're in a zombie apocalipse, BULLETS WON'T LAST FOREVER! so you just start the game without know how to play with a glock in hand 17 bullets and 3 mags, good the ♥♥♥♥ing zombies are god damn USAIN BOLTS they run, they attack like at a lot of speed. IGNORE ALL THAT and you'll have people that don't care if you're new, so if you plan on testing this game, go on but just don't expect something better than the others game on the market, it is by far the worst survival experience i've ever had.Good luck!

content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
How I installed DayZ (with Overwatch, Epoch and Origins Mods) WIP:(Assuming you know how to get tot he root folders of ArmA 2 and ArmA 2: OA.) Load ArmA 2, then ArmA 2: OA and then DayZ (choose the 1.8.7 version underneath the  Copy and paste the ArmA 2 files (or just AddOns apparently) into ArmA 2: OA folder. Download the Overwatch mod via https://www.dropbox.com/sh/gov6ocm697esi2u/AACDG0kskKPUXvJgan3q__EWa?dl=0 and extract the @dayzoverwatch  into the ArmA 2: OA Folder Download the Epoch mod via torrents (get BitTorrent or uTorrent or something) and extract the DayZ_Epoch folder into the ArmA 2: OA Folder. Download the Origins Launcher (or alternatively get the torrent and extract the @OriginsMod into the ArmA 2: OA Folder) and install the mod. Set Launch Options in ArmA 2: OA to -mod=@Dayz -mod=@dayzoverwatch -mod=@DayZ_Epoch -mod=@OriginsMod (change accordingly and make sure that anything else goes AFTER this). Enjoy!

content:
Posted: August 5, 2016
												Sure, after all this time the mod is still littered with bugs, but it is still my favorite game of all time. I am absolutely fascinated by it. The graphics, the audio, the ability the game has to immerse you into the world and just how real it feels is worth mentioning all on its own. I felt every emotion there is to feel in this game and loved every moment of it. Its just a shame that its nothing like it used to be with the new modded servers and exploits and all that... nobody plays it for the immersive experience anymore.

content:
Posted: March 10, 2014
												I know this seems like an awesome mod at first (which it is, at times, rarely, but the moments are still there) but after a few days of playing, you start to realize how pointless and hopeless this game is. You find some stuff, you get a weapon, you meet a person and 9 out of 10 times they shoot you on sight. I don't blame them though, cause that's just how this mod is. Everyone you see will either want to kill you or avoid you, but mostly kill you. Even the good guys. Either because they can't trust anyone they meet because they've been betrayed so many times or because you have something they want.I actually recommend this more than the standalone because the standalone is so boring, there's almost no content, it's pretty buggy and there's only one single map whereas in ArmA 2's mod, there's like 100 different maps and people have made 100 different versions of the mod like Breaking Point or DayZero, etc.If you do own ArmA 2 CO and haven't tried this yet then I suggest you do. The game is great both with friends and by yourself, because by yourself you're not drawing so much attention and you can do your own thing whereas with friends you can defend yourself much easier, you can scavenge quicker and you can have a bigger view over stuff, such as one person guarding and the other one looting.I do enjoy this mod at times though, when you just run into some super friendly person and you go on adventuers all over the map only for him to be killed and you scream "NOOO!" into the mic while spraying his killers, then crying over his corpse, sucking it up, looting him dry and throw yourself back out in the wilderness, alone and hungry, yet again.

number of helpful: 14 of 31 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												Warning, this game is only replayable and can offer the full experience with a group of friends. DO NOT BUY WITHOUT HAVING SOMEBODY TO PLAY WITH. This is a great experience and gives the most lifelike zombie apocolypse simulator. This game has great immersion until you find something quite common in the game, a zombie. These walking monstrosities break the game flow and any sense of immersion. The zombie combat is a mess with the ridiculous hit detection, and amount of hits with a melee weapon or with a gun. Not only the ridiculous combat is a problem but the shotty animations is a huge problem. The zombies with walk over to you, ♥♥♥♥ing flail their arms at you and you take massive damage for an attack that looked like it was done in a 4th of the time that it should. The game is terribly broken and almost all deaths are unfair leaving you in a rage state. This game may be fun to watch but sure as hell is not fun to play/

number of helpful: 9 of 21 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												A really fun and challenging zombie shooter. It is completely different from any other zombie shooter I've ever played, and it can also get really competative. It's an open world map where zombies are dangerous and humans are deadly. Everything is trying to kill you, but you can either be a lone wolf, or travel in a group of friends. However, I would not recommend this game for people who are good by nature, because trying to lend out a helping hand to a fellow survivor will earn you a bullet to the face. This game is great for playing with a friend or two and going out being bandit survivors, working as a team and scavenging military bases and making one of your own. However, there aren't really many servers left and it's hard to find one that works, runs well, has good rules, and has players. 7/10.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 5, 2016
												Tons of untapped potential.  I've dusted this one off twice in the past couple years.  First, it's horribly optimized for online play, which is only a factor if you don't have near-unlimited broadband.  Forget playing this on a hotspot or other ISP which limits your data; the game sucks up around 100MB/hour.  And expect to play for a long time, since much of the game is walking, hiding, or crawling. And, be prepared for "alpha release" glitches that haven't been fixed in the 5 or so years since this game was released.  In summary, this could have been a great game but for whatever reason it was never patched/optimized beyond "alpha" release and as such should only be fodder for existing super-hardcore fans.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												DayZ is one of the most famous mods in the world, and I can see why to some degree if you are really into super slow paced gameplay with a huge build up and lack of content all in the name of realism, but me personally find this zombie survival sim esque game to be a total drag, it has boring gameplay, satisfactory AI, pretty good multiplayer to be fair (in terms of ability to set up/join/play with friends/etc.), terrible graphics for it's time (obviously it is an Arma II mod though, so can't really complain, for Arma II's time it has decent graphics), decent engine, no story or dialog, replayability but playing it just the once is like pulling teeth, ok sound effects and simple apocalypse style world design (which you can't complain at too much either).Overall this game is a huge load of non-content, playing this on your own is a bore and with friends isn't much better. My advice to those who want this because of some sort of video is to not go and buy the two games needed for it (I can't speak on behalf of the stand-alone game). This game does look good on video but when actually playing for a decent amount of time, you'll see just how little this game has to offer, unless of course as I said earlier this game is exactly what you want (which I thought it was due to my love and fascination of this kind of scenario, it sounded too good to be true, to be able to simulate my dream of an apocalypse with the fight for survival including zombies, but no).7/15 - "Not as good as it looks"

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												After years of being public, this game randomly doesn't work, glitches, crashes, refuses to run, has no support and has no solid concept what so ever. While you play, you randomly get disconnects. Servers restart every few hours, so should you get killed, if you don't make it to your corpse before server restart, your stuff is gone. Realms are plagued with children randomly killing everyone on sight, and there is no role-playing part of the game what so ever. Different servers have different mods and customizations, that doesn't work most of the time, and if they do, players are tied down with a long list of rules of what you can or cannot do, where, and how (i.e. not killing near "safe zones", in them, no building near them, in houses, or "high loot areas.", etc). With all this, if you happen to finally be lucky to find something nice, you are likely to experience some bug which will cause the item to disappear, like if you are holding a weapon, you find a better one, you click on the item in the menu 'Take "better gun" (drop "your current gun")', your current gun gets destroyed and you only have the new one. If you switch guns, the one you just took out of your backpack never has a magazine in it. Switching between guns in combat is useless, as your character needs to stop moving altogether, stands for couple of seconds while switching guns and then you are allowed to move again. Sometimes you glitch through the stairs and die. Sometimes someone glitches through a wall and steals your car. Sometimes you glitch through a wall and appear on the other side of the building going up the ladder. This piece of software is pure garbage - I'll always love to watch Frankie's videos of him playing the game, I just don't have the nerves to play it myself.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												You there! Gaming person!Do you enjoy the heady thrill of loading screens? That adrenaline-filled moment you've spent 20 minutes waiting to connect to a server and then the connection drops for no reason? Do you love it when you spend an hour getting into a game only to spend the entire time being chased by comically badly animated zombies across an enormous, empty map?Then this one's for you. Just don't forget to continuously update and patch your game every day, because we don't want a fantastic, fun-packed 30 minute connection wait to be ruined by a message telling you the server is running a version which is 0.1.1.1.2 newer than yours now, do we?

												Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9 inch round cake pans or one 9x13 inch pan.In large bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Make a well in the center. Add eggs, coffee, buttermilk, oil and vanilla. Beat for 2 minutes on medium speed. Batter will be thin. Pour into  prepared pans.Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 40 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out   clean. content:
Posted: April 1
												I understand alot of people play and thoroughly enjoy this game. I had one game in this mod and because of the experience I had I have chosen to never play this again and becuase of what happened, do not recomend the game.Load into a server. Look around. Get a grasp of the basic  controls. See some zombies in the distance. Know I have to stay away until I get some weapons. Spot some buildings. Start heading to the buildings. It is a small yard with a small building. I sneak into the building, find a basic pistol. Exit the building and as I am about to leave the yard I hear a zombie on the other side of the fence. I freeze, I don't know what to do. I follow the noise of the zombie running around the border of the fence (corrugated so I didn't actually see it, just hear). Zombie came running around the corner but as I was not moving, as soon as it saw me it stopped, turned and started to walk away. At this point and time I  hear a noise, turn and this bus seems to materialize next to where I was standing. All these players exit fulling kitted out with weapons etc and shoot me. I am now lying on the ground, bleeding out. They are yelling at me, can you hear us. Answer us. Have you a mic. Answer us and well heal you. As I had only just started playing I had no idea what the voip was. What the chat was. And so I bleed out and died. Due to these bunch of community players I have not desire to be involved in a community like this.I have seen some great footage out there of bands of players helping each other out, banding togeither to survive. If I had had that kind of experience I may have even purchased the full game? But due to the experience I had. I just cant recoment it.It was other players that caused me to not like this game mode!

number of helpful: 0 of 10 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
												Antes que nada me gustaría destacar que este emocianante juego tiene 5 puntos centrales:1)Esperar que pongan las avariciosas ofertas de Steam.2)Comprar el juego después de salir reiteradas veces a violentar algún Fravega.3)Instalar el ARMA II y re cagarte en todo porque te olvidaste de comprar la♥♥♥♥♥♥expansión del Arrowhead, cagarte de hambre 3 meses porque toda la plata de tus atracos a la raza vil y laburante la gastaste en tucas o cartovino.5)Comerte un delicioso choripan chorreante de grasa en la Costanera.Sinceramente, el juego es como un simulador de los saqueos en pleno invierno de Gripe A, sin mucho que decir. Pero bueno, mejor hablarles de mi breve pero curiosa anécdota tratando de instalar esta garompa enfierrada a la que llaman "DayZ":Primero me volví pelotudo para poder pagar el jueguillo, terminaron las ofertas y me olvidé de comprar la expansión para poder jugar al DayZ. Posteriormente me vi obligado a llamar a Hackerman, ya que el juego no funcaba y a mi primo lo banearon antes de poder entrar a un server. Después de meterme en Skynet, matar a Robert Patrick y salvar al mundo de ser absorbido por la nariz cocainómana de Moria Casán, el juego se arregló mágicamente y pude entrar a jugar. Rapidamente me desilucioné cuando descubrí que el juego era una verdadera e inexorable pija.También me gustaría aclarar que después de corregir todos los errores del juego mi Facebook creció 30 centimetros y mi poronga cambió de color (si desea saberse, de un matiz rubí, similar al de tu profunda y abismal concha los días en los que se te cae el tuco, en la cual incontables veces llevé a naufragar al monigote de carne).

content:
Posted: January 26, 2014
												1,000+ Hours on recordThis is a really good game, although the only problem I have with it, is that it doesn't really keep track of time played through steam. Often users have to download Dayz Commander to find servers, which isn't connected to steam.This game is amazing, there are plenty of mods you can do too when you get bored of the default. I suggest Dayz Epoch (keep in mind all mods are free, you can get them through dayz commander). This  mod allows you to not only sell and buy items with gold/iron/silver currency. You can also build your own custom base! Make a tower or what ever.. Or go get a gun and go hunting for people :) Very fun game, just expect to do a LOT of running-A LOT better, and different then the Dayz Stand Alone

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
												I hate this game. Don't get me wrong, I love it. Just...bugs...Good points: there is not a more brutal online survival game. This is a game you may stop playing because it is actually too good...or because the enemy has a gun and you don't, and even if you do, you probably aren't careful enough and die anyway. Try enough you will learn how to survive (usually try #43) and is incredibly rewarding for being careful, observant and...well...better than your opponents..who are anywhere and everywhere.Bad points: To survive making your way inland (coast is perilous), finding a working vehicle, losing vehicle cos you didn't hide it well enough, walking the rest of wherever you are going, being ambushed by 4 vastly superior and better armed bandits and surviving by the skin of your teeth with one enfield rifle and 4 bullets because you landed a hit with a bullet on their key buddy that rendered him unconscious, sprinting through a forest to get away, finding a house with food, sprinting away again to escape AI zombies, only to be one shot killed by a zombie in a barn because the hit marker system bugged out when you landed an axe on the zombie's head which didn't kill it, can be infuriating.So in short: great game, just prepare for bugs. Otherwise, every other time you die will be your own fault because you were outsmarted. Oh and the hordes of AI zombies are the least of your problems, and also trust no one. Use DayZ Commander to manage the game (I have more hours on record than the 1 hour Steam says I have). Enjoy.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 22, 2013
												The only game I've ever played where my heart would race by the simple act of killing another player. Once you get used to the mechanics of the system and have yourself armed and ready for any possible threat, the interactions you have with other survivors has you literally shaking from the concern of one owns safety. Yes, you can respawn and start from scratch after you die, but the struggle of surviving the constant barrage of zombies and player encounters whilst savaging for goods, builds on the value of the current life you are current controlling. This mod is the pioneer of the genre and must play for anyone who has thought about playing a GTA style game with zombies.

												まさにゾンビサバイバルを体感できるMOD。プレイヤーは満足な装備を持たずしていきなり広大なMAPに投げ出されますそこはゾンビの闊歩する無法地帯。生き残るには食料や武器が必要になりますゾンビの視線をかいくぐりやっとのことで物資を手に入れられても、今度は別のプレイヤーに出会うことでしょうあなたのコンタクト次第ですが、物資を分け合ったり協力し合って生き残ることもできますし、ほかのプレイヤーを殺して物資を奪ってもいいのです　まさに無法地帯です物資以外にも、修理可能な車両や航空機があったりするので、そいつを直せば広大なマップを縦横無尽に走り回ることもできます高い自由度とサバイバル感を味わえる作品ですArma2持っててゾンビサバイバルを体感したい人なら是非ともやってみてください

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
												DayZ the mod is still where its at. I finally bough OA after 3 years of owning just Arma II and I wish I had sooner. If so I wouldn't have wasted 30 on DayZ SA. Like many prominent DayZ youtubers have stated like Frankie, DayZ SA jsut doesnt have the core mechanics. The gunplay is clunky and guns feel highly inaccurate and bullets are like pebbles.Being able to talk to other players and "shoot the♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; makes for a much more enjoyable experience. You dont have to eat 4 cans of beans to no longer be starving, or drink 15 sodas. The community is much more solid and Kill on Sight isn't as large a problem. Infact I was only KOSed once so far in the mod, and I am giving the player the benefit of the doubt, because I had just killed a zombie near a player corpse and was going to loot said corpse and I can only assume they though I killed the player and was a bandit. Hopefully one day the SA will be jsut as good if not better, but till then the mod is still the place to be. And its well worth the cost of Arma II and OA. Not to mention all the other Aram mods you can play, oh and don't forget about Arma II now ;)

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												The DayZ ArmA 2 mod is a fantasic mod. But alas, every game isn't perfect. To run the mod to expectation DayZ Commander is highly recommended. But if you want to play on extra maps such as Epoch, or Panthera, you will need to install those from the Commander. The thing is, if this mod didn't require so many add-ons for itself, it would be a MILLION times better. Aside from that the gameplay is fun, and so is the overall realism that a good survival game should have. And if more players didn't kill anyone on sight, well.... that would be even better. FYI, look out for angry squeakers.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2014
												This is a great mod especially if you get DayzCommander. The reason that I say this is because DayzCommander finds all versions of the game that is compatible with the current version that you have, plus it lets you download other mods for this game and not only that but it also lets you run dayz without having to launch steam (which is why my account says that I have played dayz for less than an hour when in reality i have been play for about three plus hours a day for about FIVE months). The main mod that I recommend is Epoch. What Epoch does is it gives more purpose to dayz by adding an economic system into the game. With this mod you can go all lone wolf or team up with a group to make a base and team up to do special missions on a server such as kill the bandits at a bandit stock pile and take the loot which might include an As50 tws and if your really lucky ammo for it. So far the server that I have found for the dayz mod that has been the best and most exciting is Blackhearts DayZ Epoch. This server usually fills up close to full most dayz and it almost always has admins on (you may not know it has an admin on at the time because some are unanounced admins that watch for hackers)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 9, 2016
												The Basics: Infamous zombie survival shooterPrevious Time Spent: 8 minutesExpectation of learning Curve: MediumWhy I bought this: The infamy of the Day-Z mod, great previous writing about itFirst Impressions: Similar feeling of really being in a place that I felt with ARMA II (which makes sense since it's the same engine and the same basic setting). Visuals are a bit dated since it was released roughly 5 year ago, but not so bad as to break immersion. This was immediately frightening and immersive. My first run in the game lasted roughly ten minutes, and involved running to a gas station, trying to commandeer a van, and being killed by zombies.   My 3 Hours with the Game: I signed into a Russian server to play this game, and spent my entire 3 hour evaluation period there. Over a number of runs, I found myself slowly learning the systems of the game, such as where to scavenge for things, how to sort of escape zombies, and general inventory management. Most of my time was spent walking or running through the zombie infested post-soviet countryside. That countryside, and all of the villages and towns were dotted with the undead, and salvageable  supplies. On a couple of runs, I found firearms and ammo, leading to overconfidence and extra danger. Actually hitting zombies and downing them was refreshingly challenging. I generally felt like a regular person dropped into a dangerous situation and trying to survive. And in a couple of instances, especially with human contact, this turned nightmarish.My highlight: The first time I ran into another human player in the game, I was running down the coast road past a gas station, with the hope of finding a van. Zombies were close on my tail, and I could hear them grunting behind me. As I passed the gas station, I saw a man with a gun, standing on top of a building. I didn't stop, due to the horde of undead on my tail, and kept running down the road, spotting a factory in the distance, and hoping to lose the zombies inside. A short time after passing the gas station, I heard the report of a rifle going off, and I kept running.I came upon an abandoned factory, and came inside, making my way up ladders, hoping to not be followed by the zombies. I climbed to a sort of catwalk, and heard gunshots again, and the sound of breaking glass and bullets whizzing by. So, I ran along the catwalk, making my way to a set of interior rooms, connected by stairwells. I saw a hatchet in one of the rooms, but the zombies caught up to me, causing me to retreat up the stairs again before grabbing it. From there, the human caught up to me as well, and I spent a short time trying to evade him, and the zombies in the ruined factory. Eventually I came out onto the catwalk again, and came to a point where he seemed to have a good shot at me, so I panicked and jumped, risking the fall. I landed hard, apparently breaking a leg. The screen faded and blurred, representing pain, but I was able to crawl out of the factory. I heard some more gunshots, but crawled through the long grass, escaping my tormentor, and eventually bleeding out alone outside the factory.  My verdict: This is a game I like a lot, and expect to play beyond the three hours. The experience is terrifying and compelling, and allowed for some amazing emerging narratives. I would recommend this, but I'd also suggest checking if the standalone version of the mod is easier to get ahold of.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												This game is amazing. It gives you hours of fun, and action, with in-depth exploration. You really don't need to say that much about it. Now when you start it you can only choose servers that run the mission 'DayZMod' not the one's like Epoch and such, which are mods with in a mod (*inception bawww*). While it gives you limited options with playing you can choose DayZ Launcher (Which is the new one since DayZ Commander went up and died on all of us), which has a LOT more servers you can play on, and you can install things like Epoch so you can play on those servers.This game really isn't for everyone because this game requires some patience. For example, it takes like 15 minutes to walk from Cherno to Elecktro (towns within the game). And on populated servers it can be a warzone on the coast (where you spawn), because bandits try to kill the fresh-spawns. But once you get past hours of walking, and avoiding bandits, its an awesome game. Good luck to you if you play! 9/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
												I find this game both relaxing and exhilirating.  I play solo and don't usually kill-on-sight (KOS) so my adventures are not as action packed as most others, but it's still thrilling dealing with zombies and avoiding contact with other "survivors".  There are glitches, there are cheaters, there are cry-babies, there are evil sick twisted individuals... It's whether or not you're willing to overlook those and emmerse yourself in a post-apocolyptic region surviving the elements and the hazards where there are no rules.With the DayZ Stand Alone (SA) out in early-release, I've chosen to remain within the mod until SA becomes more of a survival challenge and not another version of Call of Duty...Depending on the mod, the map, the clan, the server population... your experience could be the worst or the best.  For me, it's a great escape from reality and the ONLY game that has EVER given me an incredible adrenaline rushing, heart pounding, terror laced virtual experience!

content:
Posted: May 25, 2014
												This is a great mod especially if you get DayzCommander. The reason that I say this is because DayzCommander finds all versions of the game that is compatible with the current version that you have, plus it lets you download other mods for this game and not only that but it also lets you run dayz without having to launch steam (which is why my account says that I have played dayz for less than an hour when in reality i have been play for about three plus hours a day for about FIVE months). The main mod that I recommend is Epoch. What Epoch does is it gives more purpose to dayz by adding an economic system into the game. With this mod you can go all lone wolf or team up with a group to make a base and team up to do special missions on a server such as kill the bandits at a bandit stock pile and take the loot which might include an As50 tws and if your really lucky ammo for it. So far the server that I have found for the dayz mod that has been the best and most exciting is Blackhearts DayZ Epoch. This server usually fills up close to full most dayz and it almost always has admins on (you may not know it has an admin on at the time because some are unanounced admins that watch for hackers)

Posted: November 26, 2013
												Fantastic game, a very fun yet quite realistic simulation of an zombie apocalypse. There are many ways to play this game throughout its huge area, and both playing with friends or alone grants a exciting and addictive experience. PvP is also quite nice (if you don't mind being labeled as a bandit). By the way, I personally recommend playing this game through a great application called "DayZ Commander" it is a much greater server finder than the original one that you start through Arma II Operation Arrowhead.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Wow! This game has serious potential! DayZ has to be one of the best games I have ever played. DayZ has the simple concept of surviving. You are dumped into a post apocalyptic world infested with zombies. This may sound simple, however, it is something that I just love. The DayZ worlds (yes there has been several different worlds created for DayZ) are just beautiful. They are massive and have an eerie stillness to it that makes you so immersed into the gameplay, thinking that you are actually in a zombie inhabited world fighting for survival. The fact of being in a world with other real players is amazing. Think this to yourself: how will you interact with them? Other players makes surviving a lot harder. This is the true difficulty of the game. What makes this game really interesting is that it is your choice. You choose what to do. You can choose to help people or kill everyone you meet. Ofcourse, with the game being in alpha, the are heaps of glitches... heaps. Zombies can attack you though walls, your cars can flip and shopping marts can be filled with floating loot! These are only some of the glitches to name. But these downsides hardly affect the game. Once you play it, you will understand.  DayZ is very versatile. Many mods for this mod have already been created which are great to suit your own playing style. If you like trading and building bases, DayZ Epoch is for you. If you like your game to be more difficult, DayZ 2017 will suit you. I really like DayZ. Hopefully these glitches and other faults will be fixed as it can make the game discouraging to play. This game is already a big hit now, and what awaits for it in the future is going to be grand. DayZ has yet to be one of the best games ever.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 22, 2013
												Day Z has it's issues, it has it's flaws. Yes, many people play Day Z as Arma II with zombies, and not really as a zombie survival game. It's all about PvP and hunting other "survivors" than it is about the zombie survival. And yes, hacks are very common. Anyone that tells you otherwise has not played Day Z.All that being said, I have been playing Day Z on and off for a while now. And it can be a great experiance with the right people. So even with it's list of flaws, and lets be honest, all games have them, Day Z is still a great mod and there is a lot of fun to be had.It also pays to remember, it's still Arma in the respect that if you plan on just jumping in for a quick and easy zombie game, you're going to be very ... very ... disappointed. If you don't have time to dedicated to the experiance, and patience, or if you get upset easily when getting killed by other players for your loot, then you may want to move on to something else. Day Z is not for you.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												So there I was, creeping through a small abandoned town just outside an Industrial village. Frantically searching houses for a gun, or maybe an axe. I could hear them coming closer and I still had nothing but bandages and a box of pain killers. I didn't look long, but it didn't take long before I knew it was time to get out of this town. No sooner do I start moving, I hear them growling. They're running for me now.I sprint into a small house and out the other side, jump a fence and stop in the shadow of a house. It was there that I found my first gun. A simple pistol with one mag. They're not chasing me anymore, I've lost them. It's time to leave the coast and head for the woods- At least this is what I had hoped I had done when a voice broke the silence. "Hey buddy, you can put that gun down. You're coming with me." Said the sniper, standing calmly in the wasteland. My day had just begun. My first day in Day Z.

												This game is amazing. It gives you hours of fun, and action, with in-depth exploration. You really don't need to say that much about it. Now when you start it you can only choose servers that run the mission 'DayZMod' not the one's like Epoch and such, which are mods with in a mod (*inception bawww*). While it gives you limited options with playing you can choose DayZ Launcher (Which is the new one since DayZ Commander went up and died on all of us), which has a LOT more servers you can play on, and you can install things like Epoch so you can play on those servers.This game really isn't for everyone because this game requires some patience. For example, it takes like 15 minutes to walk from Cherno to Elecktro (towns within the game). And on populated servers it can be a warzone on the coast (where you spawn), because bandits try to kill the fresh-spawns. But once you get past hours of walking, and avoiding bandits, its an awesome game. Good luck to you if you play! 9/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 8, 2015
												For the sake of people that don't know a lot about the game, I will start with the basic concepts and how the game goes. This game is like a zombie survival shooter where the zombies don't really matter at all. The thing you have to worry about is other people. Sure, the zombies can be a pain, but people shooting you in the face on sight is the bigger problem. The concept of the game is to try to survive as long as possible and either kill any bandits looting people, or become a bandit yourself. Loot on different servers varies a lot, so the survival aspect can be a breeze or a constant struggle for food and water.This game uses more realistic aspects than many shooters. The Dayz mod uses more realistic physics (besides the part where rocks send you flying), so this means bullets drop and can go through walls. Your aim is more difficult to keep steady after sprinting. That's right, you can't sprint a mile and no scope someone after stopping on the spot. When you get hurt, you have to bandage yourself and possibly use a bloodbag to keep from passing out. You can also hunt and gut animals to give the game a more survival feel. I have had Dayz for a while (I have more hours, they are just recorded on Arma2: Operation Arrowhead for some reason), and I can say that the game has a lot of replay value. I could probably play this game for hundreds of hours and not really get bored of it, which is something that I value a lot in a game. If you like first person shooters, you'd like Dayz. If you like third person shooters, you'd like Dayz. That's right, you can toggle between either view ingame. I really like this feature because the different views have their own advantages. There are also many different vehicles to choose from. Helicopters can be tricky to learn how to fly, but eventually you get the hang of it. I suggest binding your auto hover command to the spacebar (if you get the game and learn the basic controls you'll get what I'm talking about). There are of course tanks and armored vehicles to ride across the country -did I mention the maps are huge?!- and boats to zip across to the islands. If you happen to come across someone that is friendly, the game gets alot more fun. It's a lot better when you have people to watch your back and maybe even build a base with you.If you decide to get the game, I'll tell you how to have the most fun out of it. When you download the game off steam, you get the Vanilla version, which is the basic original mod that first came out. It's more oriented towards the survival aspect, and you don't get access to many of the weapons and vehicles you could get. To expand your gameplay options, you have to get the other mods, such as Epoch or Overpoch. I think the best thing to do is to get DayZ Launcher, which is what I did. Just get dayz Launcher and use that to download the other maps and mods, since steam does not have them. Personally, I played on Vanilly for a while first to get my bearings and then switched to playing Epoch. Epoch is basically the same thing as Vanilla with a banking system, tanks, improved base building, and better weapons. You can go out and buy things instead of searching for them, which can be quite handy. Epoch also allows you to build certain vehicles if you have the right parts. If you've ever heard of someone calling the game "running simulator," just know that this feature fixes this.From what I've read from reviews, it's best to avoid the standalone version like the plague, so the mod is the next best thing. In fact, it's better! You get so much more content and a small fraction of the bugs and glitches. Even though the game is starting to get a little older, it still has a huge community, so it won't be dieing out any time soon. Even if you don't think you'd like the game, it would definitely be worth the buy if it goes on sale for an already low price to start with. Sure, it can be a little buggy sometimes, but none of the problems are even remotely game-breaking, so don't let that deter you from having fun with it.Overall, I think it is a great game and is definitely worth getting, if only to have in your library untouched till the end of time like most of the games people get*If it is unclear, to get the Mod, you have to buy Arma 2 and Arma2: Operation Arrowhead, so just buy them together in the package, then download both to your computer and then get the mod to play*

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												This game is amazing. It gives you hours of fun, and action, with in-depth exploration. You really don't need to say that much about it. Now when you start it you can only choose servers that run the mission 'DayZMod' not the one's like Epoch and such, which are mods with in a mod (*inception bawww*). While it gives you limited options with playing you can choose DayZ Launcher (Which is the new one since DayZ Commander went up and died on all of us), which has a LOT more servers you can play on, and you can install things like Epoch so you can play on those servers.This game really isn't for everyone because this game requires some patience. For example, it takes like 15 minutes to walk from Cherno to Elecktro (towns within the game). And on populated servers it can be a warzone on the coast (where you spawn), because bandits try to kill the fresh-spawns. But once you get past hours of walking, and avoiding bandits, its an awesome game. Good luck to you if you play! 9/10

content:
Posted: October 30, 2013
												possibly the best mod for a game since TFC 1.6. Not for the casual gamer or the weak of heart.Welcome to chernarus, 225 km/sq of obsolete civilization splattered with the walking dead and exorcised of security.DayZ is a survival horror game taken to a new level, offering you the chance to pit your skills against the grim reality of a future gone wrong. Take on the world, lone wolf style and let your instincts guide you as you try and simply stay alive whilst trying to outwit the many bandits and survivors that have found a home amongst the chaos, or, Group up with fellow survivors, Build a sanctuary and begin to carve your own future out of the ruins OR or Wander the plains as a madmen, carrying your sniper rifle and seeking out all the orange sherbert left in existance. good, bad or mad, only the best will survive. Trying to detail the many features of this game or the ways in which you can play it would be boring, simply put if you want a true challenge, this game is for you. ++WARNING++THIS MOD WILL EAT YOUR CPU/MEMORY Make sure you understand your system and what is going to be required of it before you attempt to play / judge

												The DayZ ArmA 2 mod is a fantasic mod. But alas, every game isn't perfect. To run the mod to expectation DayZ Commander is highly recommended. The thing is, if this mod didn't require so many add-ons for itself, it would be a MILLION times better. Aside from that the gameplay is fun, and so is the overall realism that a good survival game should have. And if more players didn't kill anyone on sight, well.... that would be even better. FYI, look out for angry squeakers.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 12, 2013
												Whatever you do, do not buy any ArmA 2 games just to get this mod. The game would be fine if there was a little more organization to what gets transfered from server to server. It's like you have to totally restart every time you log into a server, instead of being able to jump back in right where you left off. For instance, in one Epoch server I logged out on a rooftop with an inventory full of supplies and weapons. When the server was empty and I tried to log into a different Epoch server, I started off with whatever their default login inventory was and I was nowhere near where I logged off.The zombies in this game are freaking annoying as well. Sometimes they move normally, but that is rare. Most times they randomly jolt around and even glitch around which makes it impossible to use ammo sparingly. For some reason everybody says to just bring them inside a building because the devs felt it made sense to make them stop running when they are under a roof.. Makes no sense to me.5 out of 10 for me. The ideas they have in this game make it uber-realistic, up until your encounters with the problems that I stated earlier. There are more major issues than this, but if you're willing to buy this game after what I just explained, then your probably not going to be swayed.P.S.I am myself a game developer, currenltly working on a title. This should have some indication that I know a little bit about user experience and game design.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 19, 2014
												This mod is just more than a mod it sparked the idea to make a standalone game. During the game, you could encounter a friendly and decide to let him pass or to take him out, you could face a clan and if you have a clan you could basically declare war on the other group. Personally, my friends and I used DayZ commander when the server interface from Arma 2 and OA are kind of hard to navigate. To start off, my friends and I had to meet each other which could take 5 minutes but at most taking the game seriously an hour and a half if you happen to spawn on the other side of the coast. After my friends and I met up we made our way to Elektrovoszak or as people in-game refer to it as Elektro there, we would loot the multiple industrial buldings and got basic supplies like crowbars and hatchets these would come into play when we would make our way to the neighboring town of Chernogorsk or Cherno again, there are many buildings you can loot, we found our first gun in one of the two firestations. After ransacking Cherno of most of it supplies i would recommend to go to Balota and the airstrip, there are two hangars multiple barracks, control tower and even a military medical camp where you could find bloodbags to get blood back or as some games refer too it as HP, you start off with 12000 and when your blood decreases your screen starts to become black and white, once your blood gets very low you will be knocked out and you will regain conciousnes after the sand timer goes to the bottom or even in some cases your buddy will have to give you an epi pen that will make you regain conciousnes. After you hit Balota Airfield you should make your way up north towards the NE and NW airfields which will give you military grade supplies but it is a huge risk when snipers have ghille suits and hide in the foliage and wait for an unexpecting victim to try to loot the high grades buildings next thing... BOOM your leg is broken and you will begin losing blood very quickly and you will have to start all over again. DayZ Mod gives you the chance to make risky decisons, you could be a bandit who shoots people on sight for no reason just to have fun or you could be DayZ's role modles as Heros, when you get enough supplies and you come across fresh spawns on the shore and give them food, water and protection. What will be your story? 4.5/5 Stars Pros- Pro players that will help you, freedom to make decisons, make new friends. Cons- At times buggy, servers full of bandits, graphic demanding. I would highly recomend this game to anyone that like RPG's but taking it to the next level with decisons that will affect you.
